abstract: From trust planning to trip planning, it has become both easier and more difficult for the merely rich to buy services that only the superrich used to enjoy.
snippet: From trust planning to trip planning, it has become both easier and more difficult for the merely rich to buy services that only the superrich used to enjoy.
lead_paragraph: WHEN Charles D. Haines was founded 22 years ago in Birmingham, Ala., its sole job was to provide financial advice to the moderately wealthy  clients with the equivalent of $1.5 million in assets in today’s dollars.

headline.main: The Family Office, Granting Every Wish
headline.print_headline: The Family Office, Granting Every Wish

abstract: For employees of Bear Stearns, many of whom have spent most of their professional lives at Bear, the sudden collapse was unfathomable.
snippet: For employees of Bear Stearns, many of whom have spent most of their professional lives at Bear, the sudden collapse was unfathomable.
lead_paragraph: The shouts, hoarse and high-pitched, rang out in the cavernous boardroom late Sunday at Bear Stearns’s headquarters on Madison Avenue. Alan D. Schwartz, the chief executive of Bear Stearns, was briefing top executives on the deal he had just struck under duress with JPMorgan Chase and the Federal Reserve Bank of New York: their stock in Bear was now worth $2 a share.

headline.main: Aftershocks of a Collapse, With a Bank at the Epicenter
headline.print_headline: Aftershocks of a Collapse, With a Bank at the Epicenter
